verses.verse: "If a man <S%H376><s%> steals <S%H1589><s%> an ox <S%H7794><s%> or a sheep, <S%H7716><s%> and kills <S%H2873><s%> it, <S%H4376><s%> or sells it; <S%H7999><s%> he shall pay five <S%H2568><s%> oxen <S%H1241><s%> for an ox, <S%H7794><s%> and four <S%H702><s%> sheep <S%H6629><s%> for a sheep. <S%H6629><s%>
If the thief <S%H1590><s%> is found <S%H4672><s%> breaking in, <S%H4290><s%> and is struck <S%H5221><s%> so that he dies, <S%H4191><s%> there shall be no guilt of bloodshed for him. <S%H1818><s%>

If the sun <S%H8121><s%> has risen <S%H2224><s%> on him, <S%H1818><s%> guilt of bloodshed shall be for him; <S%H7999><s%> he shall make restitution. <S%H7999><s%> If he has nothing, <S%H4376><s%> then he shall be sold for his theft. <S%H1591><s%>

If the stolen property <S%H1591><s%> is <S%H4672><s%> found <S%H4672><s%> in his hand <S%H3027><s%> alive, <S%H2416><s%> whether it is ox, <S%H7794><s%> donkey, <S%H2543><s%> or sheep, <S%H7716><s%> he shall pay <S%H7999><s%> double. <S%H8147><s%>

"If a man <S%H376><s%> causes a field <S%H7704><s%> or vineyard <S%H3754><s%> to be eaten, <S%H1197><s%> and lets <S%H7971><s%> his animal <S%H1165><s%> loose, <S%H1197><s%> and it grazes in another man <S%H312><s%>'s field, <S%H7704><s%> he shall make restitution <S%H7999><s%> from the best <S%H4315><s%> of his own field, <S%H7704><s%> and from the best <S%H4315><s%> of his own vineyard. <S%H3754><s%>

"If fire <S%H784><s%> breaks out, <S%H3318><s%> and catches <S%H4672><s%> in thorns <S%H6975><s%> so that the shocks of grain, <S%H1430><s%> or the standing grain, <S%H1430><s%> or the field <S%H7704><s%> are consumed; <S%H398><s%> he who kindled <S%H1197><s%> the fire <S%H1200><s%> shall surely <S%H7999><s%> make restitution. <S%H7999><s%>

"If a man <S%H376><s%> delivers <S%H5414><s%> to his neighbor <S%H7453><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> or stuff <S%H3627><s%> to keep, <S%H8104><s%> and it is stolen <S%H1589><s%> out of the man <S%H376><s%>'s house; <S%H1004><s%> if the thief <S%H1590><s%> is found, <S%H4672><s%> he shall pay <S%H7999><s%> double. <S%H8147><s%>

If the thief <S%H1590><s%> isn't <S%H3808><s%> found, <S%H4672><s%> then the master <S%H1167><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> shall come near <S%H7126><s%> to God, <S%H430><s%> to find out if he hasn't <S%H7971><s%> put his hand <S%H3027><s%> to his neighbor <S%H7453><s%>'s goods. <S%H4399><s%>

For every matter <S%H1697><s%> of trespass, <S%H6588><s%> whether it be for ox, <S%H7794><s%> for donkey, <S%H2543><s%> for sheep, <S%H7716><s%> for clothing, <S%H8008><s%> or for any kind of lost thing, <S%H9><s%> about which one says, <S%H559><s%> <S%H1697><s%> 'This is mine,' the cause of both parties <S%H8147><s%> shall come <S%H935><s%> before God. <S%H430><s%> He whom God <S%H430><s%> condemns <S%H7561><s%> shall pay <S%H7999><s%> double <S%H8147><s%> to his neighbor. <S%H7453><s%>

"If a man <S%H376><s%> delivers <S%H5414><s%> to his neighbor <S%H7453><s%> a donkey, <S%H2543><s%> an ox, <S%H7794><s%> a sheep, <S%H7716><s%> or any animal <S%H929><s%> to keep, <S%H8104><s%> and it dies <S%H4191><s%> or is injured, <S%H7665><s%> or driven away, <S%H7617><s%> no man seeing it; <S%H7200><s%>

the oath <S%H7621><s%> of Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> shall be between them both, <S%H8147><s%> whether he hasn't <S%H7971><s%> put his hand <S%H3027><s%> to his neighbor <S%H7453><s%>'s goods; <S%H4399><s%> and its owner <S%H1167><s%> shall accept <S%H3947><s%> it, <S%H7999><s%> and he shall not make restitution.
But if it is stolen <S%H1589><s%> from him, <S%H7999><s%> he shall make restitution to its owner. <S%H1167><s%>
If it is torn in pieces, <S%H2963><s%> let him bring <S%H935><s%> it for evidence. <S%H7999><s%> He shall not make good that which was torn. <S%H2966><s%>

"If a man <S%H376><s%> borrows <S%H7592><s%> anything of his neighbor <S%H7453><s%>'s, and it is injured, <S%H7665><s%> or dies, <S%H4191><s%> its owner <S%H1167><s%> not being with it, <S%H5973><s%> he shall surely <S%H7999><s%> make restitution. <S%H7999><s%>
If its owner <S%H1167><s%> is with it, <S%H7999><s%> he shall not make it good. If it is a leased <S%H7916><s%> thing, <S%H935><s%> it came for its lease. <S%H7939><s%>

"If a man <S%H376><s%> entices <S%H6601><s%> a virgin <S%H1330><s%> who isn't <S%H781><s%> pledged to be married, and lies <S%H7901><s%> with her, <S%H4117><s%> he shall surely pay <S%H4117><s%> a dowry for her to be his wife. <S%H802><s%>

If her father <S%H1><s%> utterly <S%H3985><s%> refuses <S%H3985><s%> to give <S%H5414><s%> her to him, <S%H8254><s%> he shall pay money <S%H3701><s%> according to the dowry <S%H4119><s%> of virgins. <S%H1330><s%>
"You shall not allow a sorceress <S%H3784><s%> to live. <S%H2421><s%>
"Whoever has sex <S%H7901><s%> with an animal <S%H929><s%> shall surely <S%H4191><s%> be put to death. <S%H4191><s%>
"He who sacrifices <S%H2076><s%> to any god, <S%H430><s%> except <S%H1115><s%> to Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> only, <S%H2763><s%> shall be utterly destroyed.
"You shall not wrong <S%H3238><s%> an alien, <S%H1616><s%> neither shall you oppress <S%H3905><s%> him, <S%H1616><s%> for you were aliens in the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>
"You shall not take advantage <S%H6031><s%> of any widow <S%H490><s%> or fatherless child. <S%H3490><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> you take advantage <S%H6031><s%> of them at all, <S%H6817><s%> and they cry <S%H6817><s%> at all <S%H6817><s%> to me, <S%H8085><s%> I will surely hear <S%H8085><s%> their cry; <S%H6818><s%>

and my wrath <S%H639><s%> will grow hot, <S%H2734><s%> and I will kill <S%H2026><s%> you with the sword; <S%H2719><s%> and your wives <S%H802><s%> shall be widows, <S%H490><s%> and your children <S%H1121><s%> fatherless. <S%H3490><s%>

"If you lend <S%H3867><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> to any of my people <S%H5971><s%> with you who is poor, <S%H6041><s%> you shall not be to him as a creditor; <S%H5383><s%> neither shall you charge <S%H7760><s%> him interest. <S%H5392><s%>

If you <S%H2254><s%> take <S%H2254><s%> your neighbor <S%H7453><s%>'s garment <S%H8008><s%> as collateral, <S%H2254><s%> you shall restore <S%H7725><s%> it to him before <S%H5704><s%> the sun <S%H8121><s%> goes down, <S%H935><s%>

for that is his only covering, <S%H3682><s%> it is his garment <S%H8071><s%> for his skin. <S%H5785><s%> What would he sleep <S%H7901><s%> in? <S%H6817><s%> It will happen, when he cries to me, <S%H8085><s%> that I will hear, for I am gracious. <S%H2587><s%>
"You shall not blaspheme <S%H7043><s%> God, <S%H430><s%> nor curse <S%H779><s%> a ruler <S%H5387><s%> of your people. <S%H5971><s%>

"You shall not delay <S%H309><s%> to offer from your harvest <S%H4395><s%> and from the outflow <S%H1831><s%> of your presses. <S%H5414><s%> "You shall give the firstborn <S%H1060><s%> of your sons to me. <S%H1121><s%>

You shall do <S%H6213><s%> likewise <S%H3651><s%> with your cattle <S%H7794><s%> and with your sheep. <S%H6629><s%> Seven <S%H7651><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> it shall be with its mother, <S%H517><s%> then on the eighth <S%H8066><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> you shall give it to me. <S%H5414><s%>

"You shall be holy <S%H6944><s%> men <S%H582><s%> to me, <S%H398><s%> therefore you shall not eat any flesh <S%H1320><s%> that is torn by animals <S%H2966><s%> in the field. <S%H7704><s%> You shall cast <S%H7993><s%> it to the dogs. <S%H3611><s%>
